item.value: New York is the city with the biggest population in America. It has over 8.3 million inhabitants.

The Spine-tailed Swift is the fastest bird. It can fly at 170 kilometres per hour (105mph). The Peregrine Falcon is the fastest bird that dives headfirst down through the sky. They can travel at up to 200mph.
If you could travel from Earth to the Sun in a plane it would take you 17 years
The Universe is about 14 billion years old. The earth is young in comparison, it is only 4.6 billion years old.
The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.
The Sun's outer layer has a temperature of 6,000C . Inside the sun the temperature is 15,000,000 C.
The creator of the first working light bulb was Joseph Wilson Swan.
The world's population grows by over 100 million each year.
There are 9 planets that circle the sun.
The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean in the world. It covers about 1/3 of its surface. It is 155.557 million sq km.
English is the second most spoken language in the world.
Diamonds are the hardest substance known to man. A diamond is 58 times harder than the next hardest mineral on earth.
The biggest planet in the Solar System is Jupiter. It is 317 times as heavy as the earth
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high.
The city with the largest population is Shanghai in China. It has almost 14 million inhabitants.
The Sputnik 1, launched on October 4, 1957 by Russia, was the first human-made object to orbit the Earth.
By 2008 there were almost 1.3 billion telephone lines in the world.
In 1783 Jean Pilatre de Rozier ( a Frenchman ) made the first balloon flight, reaching a peak altitude of about 500 ft, and traveling about 51/2 mi in 20 min.
The shortest woman was Pauline Muster. She was 58 cm ( 23 in ) tall.
The creator of the first working light bulb was Joseph Wilson Swan. Thomas Edison improved on Swan's design by using a better incandescent material and a higher vacuum.
